author: raisedadead
description:
Feature Checklist:
- [x] Create API for creating/saving a temporary token
- [x] Add email template and sending logic
- [x] Add validations and timeouts
- [x] Update the sign in view
- [x] Prevent users without verified email from login
- [x] ~~Create API for creating/saving an access token~~ Using loopbacks defaults
- [x] Add routes for requesting access token
- [x] Invalidate used/expired tokens
- [x] Remove password reset logic
- [x] Handle all errors gracefully
- [x] Remove all passwords from database (#14559 issue created for DevOps)
- [x] Add debounce/disable to magic link button
- [x] Add some loading indicator to magic link button ajax request
- [ ] (berks): Investigate memory consumption issue

Closes #8165 
Closes #9027
Closes #15254

- [ ] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm run test-challenges`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.
#### Type of Change

<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->

- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)

- [ ] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX
#### Description

Related to issue no #7288, but doesn't closes it yet.

Further translation of the following challenges :
- Use a CSS Class to Style an Element
- Style Multiple Elements with a CSS Class
- Change the Font Size of an Element
- Set the Font Family of an Element
- Import a Google Font
- Specify How Fonts Should Degrade
- Add Images to your Website
- Size your Images
- Add Borders Around your Elements

<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Your pull request targets the `staging` branch of FreeCodeCamp.
- [x] Branch starts with either `fix/`, `feature/`, or `translate/` (e.g. `fix/signin-issue`)
- [x] You have only one commit (if not, [squash](http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/how-to-squash-multiple-commits-into-one-with-git/13231) them into one commit).
- [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm run test-challenges`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.
#### Type of Change

<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

It's really just a documentation change.
#### Checklist:

<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->

<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue: **I believe** Closes #9145
#### Description

<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

The Open Weather Map API was not serving over HTTPS, leading to mixed content issues, since geolocation requires HTTPS. Forecast.io's API is also free, requires sign up, but up to 1k hits per day w/ no charge or card on file.

I'm (unsurprisingly) not the first person to notice this. Seems to intersect w/ #7853 and #9145, the latter I believe it closes, at least accounts for it from the documentation side of things (as the currently recommended open weather map API leads to a funny experience, at least for Chrome users).

#### Type of Change

<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)
#### Checklist:

<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->

<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [ ] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #11111
#### Description

<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

Challenge: "Add Different Margins to Each Side of an Element"
Change the order tests are run to Top, Right, Bottom, Left.
Previous they were ordered as Top, Left, Right, Bottom.

Why: The Tests, in the order run, form a checklist of the items the student needs to perform in order to pass this challenge.
The order they were listed is not only unnatural, but is not the order they need to memorize and write their code in later.
Reordering the tests to the proper Top, Right, Bottom, Left format prepares them to think, and act in that order and aids in future memorization of the sequence.

description:
<!-- FreeCodeCamp Pull Request Template -->

- [x] Branch starts with either `fix/`, `feature/`, or `translate/` (e.g. `fix/signin-issue`)
- [x] You have only one commit (if not, [squash](http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/how-to-squash-multiple-commits-into-one-with-git/13231) them into one commit).
- [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm run test-challenges`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.
#### Type of Change

<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)
#### Checklist:

<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->

<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [ ] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX
#### Description

<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

I've started contributing to FreeCodeCamp about a week ago. When I started contributing, I also joined the Contributors chat room. From my own experience and the experience of many other new contributors, I've found there's an issue in the `npm run only-once` command. `\n` on Windows doesn't add a new line. In fact, it's even worse. In the script, it seems to break. This pull request removes the new lines. I realize that this does make these little messages harder to catch. I think the trade-off is worth it, though. Because there is no new output for a while after the first message, and the last message is the very last thing logged, they're still hard to miss. I did some research on getting newlines in the command line on Windows, but there doesn't seem to be an easy cross-platform solution.  
I hope this will help out new contributors, taking one more bump out of the road of contributing to a large open source project. 🔥

- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)
#### Checklist:

<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->

<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [ ] Tested changes locally.
- [ ] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX
#### Description

<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

Changing 'because' to 'and' alters the sense of the sentence "These conditions are known as `Boolean` conditions because [and] they may only be true or false." "Because" implies that the name `boolean` inherently implies truthiness or falsiness, which is not the case, and even if it has come to have that association for developers and mathematicians, new programming students with no development or mathematical background would not make that association.

- [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm run test-challenges`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.
#### Type of Change

<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)
#### Checklist:

<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->

<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX
#### Description

<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

In [/client/saga/err-saga.js#7](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/client/sagas/err-saga.js#L7), the dispatched action has type `app.makeToast` but there is no this type name in the project. I looked into [/common/app/redux/types.js](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/common/app/redux/types.js) which contains all the action types with prefix `app`, and `makeToast` is no where to be found. So I use the action creator from [/common/app/toasts/redux/actions.js](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/common/app/toasts/redux/actions.js) instead.

closes #11198

#### Description

<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

I updated the regex to include validation for allowable values that make the text white including the keyword white as well as hex #ffffff. Additional consideration for typos and extra space/characters that may cause the browser to ignore the color keyword. e.g. if the user types colors:white it will fail validation. I understand there is an existing pull request for this issue but I believe this is more robust.

author: greenkeeperio-bot
description:
Hello lovely humans, [react-router](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-router) just published its new version 3.0.0.
State Update :rocket:
Dependency react-router
New version 3.0.0
Type dependency
This version is **not covered** by your **current version range**. Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though. I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of react-router. Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update. Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right? Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. [Let them know](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new). Good luck with your project :sparkles: You rock! :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router/releases/tag/v3.0.0)

🎉 The 100th release of React Router! 🎉

This release removes all the deprecation warnings from v2.x along with some bugfixes.

While the focus of this project is shifting towards the component-based v4, this branch will be maintained indefinitely!

Bug fixes will continue to be accepted. We are not going to leave anyone hanging and want to assure you that v3 development will be alive and well.

Some thoughts on future improvements (would love to hear what you guys think about these!):
- Replace `npm` with `yarn`
  - Super easy transition, for most cases
- Remove CDNs for libraries like `font-awesome`, `codemirror` and `bootstrap`. These can be loaded and served by webpack.
  - Right now CDNs for `font-awesome` alone are in 12+ places. And require two different versions, I can imagine that's not ideal to manage.

Appreciate review and any feedback/comments. Thanks!!

#### Type of Change
<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #11372 

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
This PR updates the link to the old [wiki article](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/wiki/Using-MongoDB-And-Deploying-To-Heroku) on deploying MongoDB to Heroku, which is now deprecated. The new link points to the corresponding article on the [forum](http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/guide-for-using-mongodb-and-deploying-to-heroku/19347) instead. 

This problem was originally [mentioned](https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/issues/11372#issuecomment-257170744) in #11372. That issue itself has been closed since, as it originally dealt with another problem, that has been resolved through a different PR. 

A few things about this PR - 

1. I did not check the "_PR targets the staging branch_" checkbox because this change already exists in the `staging` branch. I was told to target the `backup/staging` branch instead, as this is (kind of) the production site.

2. The issue where this problem was mentioned in, is already closed. So I just mentioned the issue number in the PR template, I did not create a separate `closes XXXXX` comment, as is the norm.

Thanks!

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
In the basic javascript challenge "Comparison with the Greater Than Or Equal To Operator", the code the final return statement was `return "9 or Under"`.  This code ran if the argument variable was not greater than or equal to 10.  The string does not accurately reflect that the argument could be greater than 9, but less than 10.  All instances of `return "9 or Under"` were changed to `"Less than 10"`

<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [ ] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
@cmal faced some errors running Free Code Camp, as he shared in [this Gitter message](https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Contributors?at=582f95d4e712c9a11884ec9c). Today (in my timezone, this is technically the same day 😄), I was installing Free Code Camp with @tearingItUp786, and we faced the same errors. As it now was obvious to me this was definitely not an environment issue or user error, I decided to investigate.
This error prevents all Javascript from loading, which makes it impossible to test out anything you develop.
With the help of @cmal, I found that the cause was in react-hot-loader, and the way it interacts with React. The most recent version of React is `15.4.0`, which is allowed by our package.json (`^15.0.2` takes the most recent `15.x.x`). That had a change that made it incompatible with react-hot-loader version `1.x.x`, which is what we're using.
This change was very recent, and according to Google, more people have struggled with this starting about three days ago.
This is fixed in react-hot-loader v3, but that's still in beta. According to the creator however, it's more stable ([source](https://github.com/gaearon/react-hot-loader/issues/417#issuecomment-260995694)). I decided to try to upgrade to this version and see if things would work. It seems like it does!
I'm not familiar with how the hot reloading used to work. With the current state of things, it's hard for me to find out. From what I can tell, it seems to work as it should, but a thorough test by someone who really knows how this is supposed to work would be much appreciated.
I'm not a fan of using a beta version, but as it's more stable according to the creator, and because currently it just doesn't work completely, I believe that this is the best solution.

I view this bug as quite high priority, as any new contributors can currently not get started.

author: greenkeeperio-bot
description:
Hello lovely humans, [redux-actions](https://www.npmjs.com/package/redux-actions) just published its new version 1.0.1.
State Update :rocket:
Dependency redux-actions
New version 1.0.1
Type dependency
This version is **not covered** by your **current version range**. Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though. I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of redux-actions. Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update. Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right? Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. [Let them know](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new). Good luck with your project :sparkles: You rock! :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/acdlite/redux-actions/releases/tag/v1.0.1)

With #141 we have made other libraries incompatible with redux-actions and it resulted to an unexpected behavior (#164, #167). If an action is not a FSA, handleAction should not handle it and just pass it to the next reducer. This fix will remove the FSA check to support Non-FSA.

Fixes

  • Remove FSA check in handleAction(s) (ef4acb7) - @timche
--- The new version differs by 9 commits . - [`adbccb0`](https://github.com/acdlite/redux-actions/commit/adbccb07093fb0c826c9048ea6e33af17849e38c) 1.0.1 - [`ef4acb7`](https://github.com/acdlite/redux-actions/commit/ef4acb7e06e3ea83ea6b1b58730d40087a7f069f) Remove FSA check in handleAction(s) - [`72d7655`](https://github.com/acdlite/redux-actions/commit/72d765571d53bcd2269b968b2154db6145e918e9) 1.0.0 - [`227db63`](https://github.com/acdlite/redux-actions/commit/227db635988357f22acfb39c2328c4ad2fa5d96e) standardize on invariant for runtime checks - [`f9bf59e`](https://github.com/acdlite/redux-actions/commit/f9bf59ef6aa7336dc1d2caa13a0da198f526fe9f) Check type of payload creator (#129) - [`69f69ec`](https://github.com/acdlite/redux-actions/commit/69f69ecf70b072f0e3d6d7fdf63e10c92a12fb6f) Enforce reducer type in handleAction (#156) - [`26a9ccb`](https://github.com/acdlite/redux-actions/commit/26a9ccb6c7130a51e4b2def7d589f0908232c0ef) Make defaultState required when creating reducers (#127) - [`ea04ccf`](https://github.com/acdlite/redux-actions/commit/ea04ccf6b52d45e0d11d016ddce462a5f5b93fd3) fix(handleAction): Add descriptive error for missing or invalid actions (#141) - [`aaaa110`](https://github.com/acdlite/redux-actions/commit/aaaa1109c08aa0a342b50654831b67773d011a88) Omit payload on undefined only (#128) See the [full diff](https://github.com/acdlite/redux-actions/compare/4b6a9805f76063f6c8e93f864ad74279c55874a6...adbccb07093fb0c826c9048ea6e33af17849e38c). --- This pull request was created by [greenkeeper.io](https://greenkeeper.io/). Tired of seeing this sponsor message? :zap: `greenkeeper upgrade`

author: systimotic
description:
<!-- FreeCodeCamp Pull Request Template -->

<!-- IMPORTANT Please review https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md for detailed contributing guidelines -->
<!-- Help with PRs can be found at https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Contributors -->

#### Pre-Submission Checklist

<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->

- [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm test`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.

#### Type of Change
<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [ ] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Hello there human!

The other day, I was looking at the CONTRIBUTING.md file, when I noticed a typo! 😱 _I have to fix this!_
After I opened the file, I ended up fixing and tweaking some other things as well. Here's a summary:
- My editor (Atom) automatically removed some trailing spaces
- There was only a single "I" in the entire file. I changed it to be more consistent.
- The Contributors chat room on Gitter is referenced as "Contributors chat room," "Contributors Chat Room" and "Contributors room", sometimes as a link, sometimes not. I edited some cases to be more consistent.
- The "How to find the code in the Free Code Camp codebase to fix/edit?" was in the PR section. I moved it near "Make changes" to hopefully be easier to find and harder to miss.
- With the current state of the project, after making changes to the seed files, you need to run `node seed` for them to be visible. This was never mentioned in this file. I added a section that talks about this. I assume it wasn't there because it previously updated automatically. I hope this helps resolve a common confusion among new contributors.
- Previously, the test section mentioned running a different command on Windows to test. This has been fixed (ref #10885), so I removed that part.
- The linting section mentioned that lines shouldn't be longer than 80 characters because of jsonlint. I'm not sure why or how that ever worked. As the name might suggest, jsonlint only lints the JSON. The linting talked about in this section only lints the .js and .jsx files. There is no maximum line length in the JSON files. I have tested this, it doesn't break. I removed this section because it seemed to be false information. 😅 Apart from that, it seems weird to me to only detail a single rule out of alllll of them.
- These last two are really nitpicking. I fixed the casing on a username. I also switched the order of two items in an unordered list to match the headings that followed it.

I know it's not such a great idea to stuff many different things into a single PR, but once I got started, I couldn't stop myself 😊

Have a great day! 🔥

author: greenkeeperio-bot
description:
Hello lovely humans, [redux-form](https://www.npmjs.com/package/redux-form) just published its new version 6.2.1.
State Update :rocket:
Dependency redux-form
New version 6.2.1
Type dependency
This version is **not covered** by your **current version range**. Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though. I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of redux-form. Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update. Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right? Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. [Let them know](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new). Good luck with your project :sparkles: You rock! :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/releases/tag/v6.2.1)

Bug Fixes

  • Do not unregister fields if the form should not be destroyed on unmount #2113
  • Values passed to sync validation function must be defined #2091 #2090
  • Fixed DateTimePicker in react-widgets example. #2119
  • Persist warnings through initialize() action. #2151 #2142
  • Fixed bug when using Fields inside a FormSection. #2154 #2148
  • Allow null to empty string conversion overwrite using format. #2171 #2062

Features

  • Added @@ in front of action names to conform with industry standard. This should not affect you if you were properly importing action strings to listen to redux-form actions, but if you were being naughty and using strings, you might have a problem. #2110
  • Added submitError parameter to onSubmitFail() call. #2134
  • Export registerField and unregisterField action creators. #2126
  • 2.5x speed improvement fix to setIn(). 🚗 💨 #2175
  • Included fields structure in looping calls (fields.map(), fields.forEach(), etc.) to allow the renderer to call fields.remove(). #2187
--- The new version differs by 703 commits . - [`a442480`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/a442480625e66d2c5980817112d0891cc43997b3) 6.2.1 - [`1250fd8`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/1250fd80039e3e94f0204413baabe4def363b523) Pass reference to the `fields` prop (#2187) - [`439904c`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/439904c6da117e61d9e39fd6b43f88ef886f4d5f) Merge pull request #2171 from martinhorsky/master - [`beb52ff`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/beb52ffd8d9d134ad7ff0456ae935aeab14f0f9f) Merge pull request #2175 from huan086/setInPerformance - [`1cf3829`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/1cf3829d008bb744485a4c13afc437672df74eab) Rewrite setInPath for 2.5x speed improvement. - [`a29c29e`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/a29c29e161f211424cc7f4fee33836b6a099f163) Allow null to empty string conversion override using format - [`4326509`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/43265091c9347f1fea02b2568fee38a5e572d841) Merge pull request #2170 from oyeanuj/patch-1 - [`0e21125`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/0e2112529b64babbd5588bc744a23cd25b655569) Fix typo - [`637159f`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/637159fe72354657794d1a28b16dc074b48cbeb4) Fix typo - [`0f1230e`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/0f1230e6059ffc4f2da522bfe270a4cc040321ee) Merge pull request #2126 from mgh/export-register-field-actions - [`9d46075`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/9d46075d9f3abbfc78a969ce54c265bcb366281f) Merge pull request #2154 from bmv437/FormSection-Fields-names-fix - [`f25f3e7`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/f25f3e7fc66caa446af430a88d5dea018f2e136d) remove sectionPrefix from Fields component names when passing down to the rendered component. - [`cec0c7e`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/cec0c7ea936db0dbf7cf167133d394e6f41982f4) Merge pull request #2151 from bmv437/initialize_persist_warnings - [`124ff2e`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/124ff2e3d547da5e1ff9a3f4d2dcf046b481df11) added a test - [`60357bd`](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/commit/60357bda1e478898938fdcca9c1277396bdb358f) persist warnings through the initialize() action. fixes erikras/redux-form#2142 There are 250 commits in total. See the [full diff](https://github.com/erikras/redux-form/compare/41ee20d5d0755b6c62082ed60f8476c510d7f5bc...a442480625e66d2c5980817112d0891cc43997b3). --- This pull request was created by [greenkeeper.io](https://greenkeeper.io/). License file: LICENSE.md
```sh
License hash: e39dd9de43f49c12d4405ac5350d778ad325dafd
Attribution: Copyright (c) 2016, Free Code Camp.
License: BSD 3-clause "New" or "Revised" License
Confidence: 100.00%
Method: Licensee::Matchers::Exact
```

author: greenkeeperio-bot
description:
Hello lovely humans, [react-redux](https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-redux) just published its new version 5.0.0.
State Update :rocket:
Dependency react-redux
New version 5.0.0
Type dependency
This version is **not covered** by your **current version range**. Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though. I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of react-redux. Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update. Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right? Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. [Let them know](https://github.com/greenkeeperio/greenkeeper/issues/new). Good luck with your project :sparkles: You rock! :palm_tree: --- [GitHub Release](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/releases/tag/v5.0.0)

This release is brought to you by contributions from the following people: @jimbolla, @vhmth, @btd, @roncohen, @ynonp, and @appden. In addition, there were many non-code contributions in discussions on issues and testing the alpha, beta, and rc versions by many other folks (too many to list!). Thank you to everyone who made this a very positive, inclusive, well-critiqued, community-driven release!

TL;DR

  • Backwards compatible API
  • Major internal changes
  • Significant performance improvements in common usage patterns
  • Bugs fixed
  • Additional features added to connect()
  • New connectAdvanced() API
  • What's next?

API Compatibility

Version 5.0 maintains API compatibility with v4.x but due to major internal changes and potential behavior differences across nearly all API surfaces, semver dictates a major version bump. Also, it's good marketing! 💰 Store state change notifications sent to components are now guaranteed to occur top-down, so if your code may behave differently if it relied on notifications happening out of order.

Internal Changes

Internally, the code for connect has been rewritten from the ground-up to be more modular, with the intention of greater maintainability and extensibility. This has also led to some new features and performance improvements.

Performance improvements

Significant performance gains were achieved by avoiding extra calls to setState() and render() by ensuring the order of change notifications to occur top-down, matching React's natural flow. Performance tests and benchmarks are discussed in #416.

Bugfixes

Some bugs/issues are resolved, related to performance loss and also impure components not re-rendering.

New features added to connect()

The behavior of connect() is now more customizable, by passing additional properties in the options arg. These will be described in the API docs.

New top level API: connectAdvanced()

The new implementation of connect() splits its behavior such that it is now a wrapper around a more-generalized connectAdvanced(). This connectAdvanced() method can be called directly if you have extreme performance needs or want to craft an API different than that of connect(). This will be described in the API docs.

What's next?

We're looking at removing the shouldComponentUpdate optimization. Since this version is much more performant on its own, that isn't needed. This will fix long-standing problems with other libraries that use React's context API. There are workarounds, but things should work without either library authors having to bend over backwards or React having to make API changes.

We will accept bugfixes on the 4.x branch (the 3.x branch will be going away; but the tags to 3.x versions will remain!), but new features should be built against the next branch. We love PRs, so keep them coming!

Changes since v5.0.0-rc.1

--- The new version differs by 197 commits . - [`e23991f`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/e23991fab5080ebe60858b3775121ba0416a556a) 5.0.0 - [`f892ec0`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/f892ec00d7e92ff7afb21498276472f0e3b000c5) 5.0.0-rc.2 - [`710cb85`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/710cb85df7e8bafd9705b557425c96deba6d78fd) Update yarn deps - [`2000ff5`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/2000ff54aef486d955a7eb4fe9594e0b5e273458) Fixes #525 (cursor bug) by moving notify from setState callback to componentDidUpdate. (#557) - [`1e5e7c4`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/1e5e7c4bff8e24d984f1703fe33dadae4c43749d) 5.0.0-rc.1 - [`7e7790d`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/7e7790dbfa2ae40fcbaacc64a6835cde73fc650e) Update all our deps. - [`f41df99`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/f41df993d18a357f92c17fb42b831e9f60a28805) Adds react15CompatibilityMode setting (#540) - [`582b17f`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/582b17f24ca31b7bd914c4f42012c53fb663ebba) Shows more helpful error when connect() is passed invalid args. (#554) - [`d5180b5`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/d5180b582ff35192a9f88fc64809f451b715cafd) Error message changed in React 15. - [`9e9c725`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/9e9c725b1e329a26adb0c4f04632f99ee86d5f51) Don't pass props to divs to avoid unknown props errors. - [`f0df2d9`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/f0df2d9296d9b54348b417ccabe5ed9447591ae9) Bump up to React 15. Add a yarn.lock (for 😎-ness) - [`217e98a`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/217e98a65ca652a0982ffb9ea4e3815e126cfc9b) Fix error from clear() called during notify() (#517) - [`0050678`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/00506786634e3ae1fc9905fe21631106355e2a97) Supress eslint error "react/display-name" at intentional omission. - [`8c3ecee`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/8c3ecee7b165effe3bd46a54cb57816a2f706417) 5.0.0-beta.3 - [`4e8b313`](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/commit/4e8b313b9ade10f1904198102199b4d18d39ed89) Revert "warn on duplicate props" (#511) There are 197 commits in total. See the [full diff](https://github.com/reactjs/react-redux/compare/4fca3cbc736b7462de65f589d3b0fdab0cb7a495...e23991fab5080ebe60858b3775121ba0416a556a). --- This pull request was created by [greenkeeper.io](https://greenkeeper.io/). Tired of seeing this sponsor message? :zap: `greenkeeper upgrade`

author: raisedadead
description:
This adds a simple email-based mechanism to report profiles for abuse. An email with text from the report is sent to Free Code Camp's support account with the reporter's account in copy. This also adds the reporter's details to the report for follow ups.

Tested locally.

Closes #11891

author: systimotic
description:
<!-- FreeCodeCamp Pull Request Template -->

<!-- IMPORTANT Please review https://github.com/FreeCodeCamp/FreeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md for detailed contributing guidelines -->
<!-- Help with PRs can be found at https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Contributors -->
<!-- Make sure that your PR is not a duplicate -->

#### Pre-Submission Checklist
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick all the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- All points should be verified, otherwise, read the CONTRIBUTING guidelines from above-->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Your pull request targets the `staging` branch of FreeCodeCamp.
- [x] Branch starts with either `fix/`, `feature/`, or `translate/` (e.g. `fix/signin-issue`)
- [x] You have only one commit (if not, [squash](http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/how-to-squash-multiple-commits-into-one-with-git/13231) them into one commit).
- [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm test`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.

#### Type of Change
<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #12271

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

Here's my test code:
```js
var hi = 'potato';

function right() {
  return 'wrong';
}

console.log('normal thing');
console.log('// this should not really do what it does, but oh well');
console.log(NaN);
console.log([8, null, 0, NaN, undefined, "", 'text', hi, right]);
console.log(['array', ['nested array', ['nested nested array', undefined]]]);
console.log(right());
console.log({
  property: '1',
  otherProperty: 1,
  'anotherProperty': NaN
});
```
This is what that looks like on the current staging branch
![chrome_2017-01-02_15-23-24](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7262039/21590857/802bd14c-d0ff-11e6-96b8-8a85ecbc1d2a.png)
This is what it looks like after my changes
![chrome_2017-01-02_14-06-49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7262039/21590858/802bf1e0-d0ff-11e6-86a3-38e638b90093.png)

### Things that work great now
- Strings actually show up as strings
- Previously, `undefined` and `NaN` were converted to `null`. They now stay as is.
- Objects are prettified.
- Arrays get an extra space, like they have in the browser console.

### Things that aren't perfect yet
_Nested arrays are now recursively parsed._
- ~Nested arrays and~ property values are still handled by `JSON.stringify`, so they still have the `NaN` -> `null` issue.
- All strings that start with // are displayed as comments.
- ~The indentation of indented arrays doesn't necessarily have to be this way. I guess it comes down to our preference.~
- If there is a lot of logging output, the performance hit may be too big. This change doesn't affect that a whole lot though. It might be good to not log anything larger than `x`.


~Tests are still broken as per #12305. I ran them with the fix from #12317, and they passed.~ Tests have been fixed

- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #12352 

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Changed the function call from `findOne()` to `update()` with the `multi` parameter set to `true`. This approach no longer requires the extra step of updating the attributes of the user that was found using the `findOne()` function call. Rather, in one function call, we can update the appropriate attributes of all users that have the same email address. Also, because the update function returns a counter that indicates the number of users that were found, the "Email address not found." error can still be displayed when the counter is equal to zero.

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
For free users, c9.io provide only 2GB memory for single workspace. But to run mongodb it requires at least 3379MB in journal. So we should use mongod --port 27017 --smallfiles to allow run mongodb within the provided 2GB memory.

- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [ ] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Partial completion of issue #12472 - for replacing all instances of "Free Code Camp", "freecodecamp", etc. with "freeCodeCamp" within the codebase. 

This PR targets all instances within the `FreeCodeCamp/server/` directory. There's also replacements in `seed/challenges/04-video-challenges/jslingo.json`, but from here on out will be targeting one directory per PR. This way QA will hopefully not be too much of a nightmare for this if too much at once is changed. 

I tried to update just about anything a user can see and anything else that might be searchable including, email domains (from `...@freecodecamp.com` to `...@freeCodeCamp.com`), user facing URLs/links, copy, etc., while leaving alone `href` attributes and instances of `freecodecamp` in file names, etc. Hopefully this is what was intended. If anything looks wrong, please let me know and I will fix and make a new PR.

author: IsaacAbrahamson
description:
#### Proposed documentation enhancement to README.md

Free Code Camp also has an awesome forum and wiki which are not mentioned with our other places (Gitter, Youtube, Medium, etc.). I propose we add links to these places in the relevant section as people viewing the repository may be interested in viewing them.

Issue: https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/issues/12502

Old pull request: https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/pull/12503

The markdown files use URLs to link to various other pages/platforms. In cases where the platform has been renamed accordingly, like `https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp`, I have made the corresponding change in the linked URLs as well. However, some other platforms are not yet renamed, like Gitter - `https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Contributors`, YouTube, the forum, etc. So I left it as is. 

Also renamed file `LICENCE-Free-Code-Camp-Curriculum.md` as per the suggestion in #12472 .

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

This adds a "releasedOn" date so they will get a "New" tag in the challenge map (though this feature has yet to be implemented in our reactified platform).

I also moved some of our retired backend projects into our "take-home practice projects" section so campers can still build them if they're looking for extra practice.

Finally, I fixed the "isRequired" flag for a couple of the intermediate algorithm challenges that were moved over from advanced algorithm challenges (and were previously un-required)

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
This is a partial completion of issue #12693 

This PR:
- Title case array challenges
- Reformat Object challenges to FCC format:
  - `code` tags for language keywords
  - `dfn` tags for key terms
  - `blockquote`s for examples, etc. 
- Fixed the way the test cases were being displayed by adding `'message: ...`
- Replaced all "Instructions" `h4` headers with `hr` elements as discussed in #12688
- Added `console.log()` around all function calls to log the result in the FCC challenge console
- Other reformatting and refactoring to prevent challenges from being cheated, etc. 

I've worked through this entire section locally and all tests pass and I can see no obvious bugs. This completes what the issue was originally opened for and I would say these are pretty well QAd at this point, but still leaving the original issue open for the time being in case there are a couple of other small things to be done. @bonham000, as discussed, if you want to go over the array section and see if there's anything you'd like to add...

Found this kind-of-old-but-fun issue. I was doing keyboard shortcut stuff today anyway, so I thought I'd go ahead and implement this.
Pressing the left arrow key goes to the previous slide, right arrow key goes to the next. If the next slide is blocked, you'll have to open the link first.
This is on `keyup` instead of `keydown`, so that you don't accidentally skip over a bunch of stuff by holding down the key.

I'm very, very new to React, so feedback would be awesome!

#### Description
As described in the issue, the closing backticks for a codeblock are indented, which makes them display as code.
It appears that there's an issue with dedent. I tried adding newlines before it both as lines that were empty in the editor and as `\n`, but it did not help.
I switched the code from dedent to good old string concatenation, which works fine.

author: no-stack-dub-sack
description: #### Pre-Submission Checklist - [x] Your pull request targets the `staging` branch of freeCodeCamp. - [x] Branch starts with either `fix/`, `feature/`, or `translate/` (e.g. `fix/signin-issue`) - [x] You have only one commit (if not, [squash](http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/how-to-squash-multiple-commits-into-one-with-git/13231) them into one commit). - [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm test`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes. #### Type of Change - [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality) - [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality) - [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations) #### Checklist: - [x] Tested changes locally. - [x] Closes currently open issue: Closes #12865 #### Description The [Quoting Strings with Single Quotes](http://beta.freecodecamp.com/en/challenges/basic-javascript/quoting-strings-with-single-quotes) challenge was affected when `'use-strict'` was added to the comment that is invisible to users. Similar to the issue seen in #12722. This challenge uses a regex to count the quotes in the `code` variable, so `'use strict'` and the `tail` was throwing off the count. Logging `code` looks like this: ``` ``` So there is an additional pair of both `'` and `"`. I tried to just accommodate for this by changing the test to account for the extra quotes, but my guess is that since this comment is not actually generated in nodes test environment, approaching it this way caused running `npm test` to fail. So instead, I created an IIFE that executes within the assert and returns `true` or `false`. It slices `code` down to only the relevant parts then just runs the original regex matches against the new string. I also added `blockquote`s for the examples to be consistent with other challenges and added `Do not change anything else.` to the instructions because we are also testing that the string remains unchanged in the first test but don't explicitly say it anywhere, so if someone does what the tests ask but changes the URL in the string, the tests will fail with an erroneous error message.

- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
- [X] Tested changes locally.
- [X] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #9583 

#### Description
Implements @erictleung's suggested changes from [#9651 (comment)](https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/pull/9651/files#r71084020).

This solves the issue mentioned above, but I'm still not happy with the result. Ideally, campers should be able to add `console.log(timesFive(someNumber))` to test their function and see the result in the simulated console to the left on their screen.

However, it's currently only possible to see this test output when the challenge is freshly loaded from the seed (either by visiting it for the first time or by resetting it). As soon as tests has been run, all that's displayed is 
```txt
// running test
// tests completed
```

I'm open for any suggestions!

It won't catch all possible ways, but it's better than nothing.

description:

#### Pre-Submission Checklist
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick all the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- All points should be verified, otherwise, read the CONTRIBUTING guidelines from above-->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Your pull request targets the `staging` branch of freeCodeCamp.
- [x] Branch starts with either `fix/`, `feature/`, or `translate/` (e.g. `fix/signin-issue`)
- [x] You have only one commit (if not, [squash](http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/how-to-squash-multiple-commits-into-one-with-git/13231) them into one commit).
- [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm test`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.

#### Type of Change
<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [ ] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX

Progress towards issue #12698, which is a compiled list of QA tasks for the new ES6 section introduced in beta

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
* Updated instructions to fixed spelling/grammar mistakes and performed minor rewording for clarification.
* Improved overall formatting of instructions by adding multi-line blockquotes for example code and by formatting inline code to identify variables and keywords in the instructions text.
* Changed titles of challenges to better conform to the format used in the titles in the Basic Javascript section where appropriate.
* Where appropriate, made minor changes to the challengeSeed syntax to conform with freeCodeCamp style guidelines (e.g. added a few semicolons, added spaces between function statement and function block, etc.) without changing functionality.
* Made no improvements to the functionality of the tests for any of the challenges. That is still needed in some cases.

author: systimotic
description:
#### Pre-Submission Checklist
- [x] Your pull request targets the `staging` branch of freeCodeCamp.
- [x] Branch starts with either `fix/`, `feature/`, or `translate/` (e.g. `fix/signin-issue`)
- [x] You have only one commit (if not, [squash](http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/how-to-squash-multiple-commits-into-one-with-git/13231) them into one commit).
- [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm test`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.

#### Type of Change
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): 
   Closes #12941
   Closes #12842
   Original: #11547

#### Description
Woo! So this is probably the biggest change I have made to date. A lot of hours went into understanding what's going on here.

Challenges with `isBeta: true` would display in production, but without title.
This was because the challenges weren't being filtered from the blocks. The titles were taken from the `searchNames`, which were filtered, so no title showed up.

@BerkeleyTrue This is my first time making a change this "major", and my first time changing the tests. Your review would be much appreciated.

author: greenkeeperio-bot

Type devDependency

There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though. - [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #12716

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Added a comma to separate x and y data points for the text inside of the text element. The previous code would end up adding the the x and y values into a singular value as the text to display for the text element. 

Previous  code and output:
```js
.text((d) =>  (d[0] + 
 + d[1]))
```
![screen shot 2017-02-01 at 07 47 41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18746599/22511446/f8a3064e-e852-11e6-9a99-f18441d30dcd.png)

Current code and output:
```js
.text((d) =>  (d[0] + ", "
 + d[1]))
```
![screen shot 2017-02-01 at 07 46 38](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18746599/22511479/10a8837c-e853-11e6-9cd4-1278c6d446e4.png)

Now x and y data points displayed as text are separated by a comma.

- [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm test`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.

#### Type of Change
<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
This PR is a partial completion of issue #12472.

This mainly targets `seed` files, but I ran a search when I was finished with that directory and found a couple of nagging left over little buggers in other areas of the codebase, so I went ahead and fixed those as well.

I've replaced every instance (visible to the user) of `Free Code Camp`, `free code camp`, `FreeCodeCamp`, `freecodecamp`, and `FREE CODE CAMP` with the much more highly desirable `freeCodeCamp` - except in irrelevant URLs not visible to the user or where required by challenges (ex. regex challenges include other cases in  tests). I did hit some URLs (only the ones that we've changed, i.e. github, codepen), and, I even got the issue template! 

I did mention in #12472 that I did leave a few instances of `freecodecamp` in the Twitch challenge, because not sure how the API would interpret the case change. Also, our name has not yet been changed on Twitch, and we may have left that out of the change plan (looks like we're still FreeCodeCampin' over there! 😜  ).

Anyway, one step closer to putting this issue to rest finally!

author: dnahol
description: #### Pre-Submission Checklist - [x] Your pull request targets the `staging` branch of freeCodeCamp. - [x] Branch starts with either `fix/`, `feature/`, or `translate/` (e.g. `fix/signin-issue`) - [x] You have only one commit (if not, [squash](http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/how-to-squash-multiple-commits-into-one-with-git/13231) them into one commit). - [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm test`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes. #### Type of Change - [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue) - [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality) - [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality) - [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations) #### Checklist: - [x] Tested changes locally. - [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #13014 #### Description Fixed challenge test in Applied Visual Design: Decrease the Opacity of An Element. Correct answer was causing a failure in Safari due to precision error. Used Assert.approximately() to fix issue. Confirmed correct answer now passes in both Safari and Chrome. Before in Safari (Correct answer does not pass): After in Safari (Correct answer passes): After in Chrome (Correct answer still passes): NOTE: Original issue was observed in Mozilla, which turned out to be a different issue that might be resolved once other merges in the pipeline happen. This pull request is addressing the issue with Safari only, as decided in the issue conversation. See conversation in issue #13014 for more detail.

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Rewrote the challengeSeed for the "Compare Scopes of the var and let Keywords" ES6 challenge to:
* Reduce the complexity of the challenge, which better highlights the different scopes assigned to the variables declared with `var` or `let`.
* Avoid the dubious coding practice of defining a function within a for loop and the associated linting error in the challenge's code.

Additional Changes:
* Expanded the "note" section to include a statement saying that in your own programs its probably best to use different names for the variables to avoid confusion.
* Added test case placeholders. These will need to be addressed in the future once transpiling issues are resolved.
* Very slight rewording of instructions.

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

These changes target the Singly Linked List Data Structure challenge.

Specifically, they deal with enhancing the descriptions to improve readability and aid in comprehension, as the instructions and descriptions were unclear. Grammar errors were corrected, and word choice improved.

The "helper" methods for 'size()' and 'head()' were removed as these were redundant and unnecessary, and the tests for each section were updated to reflect this change. Wherever a test called for the size or head of a list, the length and head properties were used respectively.

- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #13286 

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

CSS transition added so that the carets rotate from right to down or vice versa when the accordion panels expand / contract. Vendor prefixes included for webkit, moz and ms.

SLIGHT ISSUE: the carets for the nested headings sit within a rectangular shaped span box and so when they rotate they go off centre (but only for a moment). See photos:

![screen shot 2017-02-15 at 18 21 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22368483/22997994/ce64123a-f3cc-11e6-9dfe-4739718399a5.png)
![screen shot 2017-02-15 at 18 21 35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22368483/22997995/ce698774-f3cc-11e6-803f-559245177e3d.png)

I've tried to fix this using transform-origin but didn't see it making any difference. 

The carets in panel titles rotate correctly.

description:
<!-- freeCodeCamp Pull Request Template -->

<!-- IMPORTANT Please review https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md for detailed contributing guidelines -->
<!-- Help with PRs can be found at https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Contributors -->
<!-- Make sure that your PR is not a duplicate -->

#### Pre-Submission Checklist
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick all the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- All points should be verified, otherwise, read the CONTRIBUTING guidelines from above-->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Your pull request targets the `staging` branch of freeCodeCamp.
- [x] Branch starts with either `fix/`, `feature/`, or `translate/` (e.g. `fix/signin-issue`)
- [x] You have only one commit (if not, [squash](http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/how-to-squash-multiple-commits-into-one-with-git/13231) them into one commit).
- [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm test`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.

#### Type of Change
<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #13268 

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
1. Used `<blockquote>` to contain the example code, instead of `<code>` tags, as recommended in issue.
2. Removed this from the challenge seed - `a = b; b = a;`. This causes `a` to be `6`, without even using array destructuring, and the first test I wrote passes by default. I think having the first test passing, without writing any code to use array destructuring at all, might confuse campers.
3. Wrote tests to ensure value of `a` and `b` was `6` and `8` respectively after destructuring, and to check array destructuring was used.

Tested locally - 

![screenshot 2017-02-19 02 20 54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11348778/23100326/3e246972-f64c-11e6-9aca-445f2a63cb8a.png)

Closes #13268

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
I have made changes in challenge.less and have set optimal breakpoint to make the iPhone frame disappear (display:none). The breakpoint I found suitable was 1030px and everything now works as intended. I have also checked for any additional bugs that I might have created but wasn't able to find any.

There is one noticeable thing that I found, Whenever the screen width is less then 1200px the iPhone frame disappears where as it should not disappear if I compare it with the production site. This is happening due to hidden-xs class on a parent div element of iPhone frame. I left this other bug as it is because I think it could be the way you guys would have liked it.

#### Type of Change
<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #13456

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

If you don't go for array.sort and try to find one by one the max in each sub-array, if you init maxTemp (temp max for each sub-array) with 0, you can pass the exercise because all the FCC tests are with positive numbers, but if I had an all negative sub-array, my max would had been 0 for that particular sub, and I would still pass the test.

See an example of wrong code that would pass this exercise:

```
function largestOfFour(arr) {
  var maxArr = [];
  for (var i = 0; i < arr.length; i++) {
    var maxTemp = 0;
    for (var j = 0; j < arr[i].length; j++){
      if (arr[i][j] > maxTemp) { 
        maxTemp = arr[i][j];
      }
    }
    maxArr.push(maxTemp);
  }
  return maxArr;
}

```

Ofc, if I change maxTemp to be 1st number from each sub-array, then this would pass the test, including the new test I added with negative only [-72, -3, -17, -10].

- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #13312 

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Added a test to check for cases where `remove()` is passed an element that doesn't exist in the set. This code passes all the tests- 
```
this.remove = function(element) {
      if(this.has(element)) {
        var pos = collection.indexOf(element);
        collection.splice(pos, 1);
        return true;
      }
      return false;
    };
```
while just removing `element` without checking if it exists, fails the new test.

Also fixed some minor formatting issues.

Closes #13312

author: greenkeeperio-bot
description:
Hello lovely humans, [loopback](https://www.npmjs.com/package/loopback) just published its new version 3.4.0.
State Update :rocket:
Dependency loopback
New version 3.4.0
Type dependency
This version is **not covered** by your **current version range**. Without accepting this pull request your project will work just like it did before. There might be a bunch of new features, fixes and perf improvements that the maintainers worked on for you though. I recommend you look into these changes and try to get onto the latest version of loopback. Given that you have a decent test suite, a passing build is a strong indicator that you can take advantage of these changes by merging the proposed change into your project. Otherwise this branch is a great starting point for you to work on the update. Do you have any ideas how I could improve these pull requests? Did I report anything you think isn’t right? Are you unsure about how things are supposed to work? There is a collection of [frequently asked questions](https://greenkeeper.io/faq.html) and while I’m just a bot, there is a group of people who are happy to teach me new things. author: Manish-Giri
description:
<!-- freeCodeCamp Pull Request Template -->

<!-- IMPORTANT Please review https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md for detailed contributing guidelines -->
<!-- Help with PRs can be found at https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Contributors -->
<!-- Make sure that your PR is not a duplicate -->

#### Pre-Submission Checklist
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick all the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- All points should be verified, otherwise, read the CONTRIBUTING guidelines from above-->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Your pull request targets the `staging` branch of freeCodeCamp.
- [x] Branch starts with either `fix/`, `feature/`, or `translate/` (e.g. `fix/signin-issue`)
- [x] You have only one commit (if not, [squash](http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/how-to-squash-multiple-commits-into-one-with-git/13231) them into one commit).
- [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm test`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.

#### Type of Change
<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #13493  

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Added tests to verify that a `number` was returned. After this change - 

OP's code does not pass - 
```
function getIndexToIns(arr, num) {
  arr = arr;
  for (var i in arr.sort(function(a,b){return a-b;})){
    if (arr[i] >= num) {return i;}
  }
  return arr.length;
}

getIndexToIns([3, 10, 5], 3);
```
![screenshot 2017-02-25 19 59 03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11348778/23336167/97b44e64-fb95-11e6-8690-a4d6f5ec4681.png)

While this code does - 
```
function getIndexToIns(arr, num) {
  // Find my place in this sorted array.
  arr.push(num);
  arr.sort(function(a,b){return a-b;});
  return arr.indexOf(num);
}
```
![screenshot 2017-02-25 19 59 43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11348778/23336170/bc5c310a-fb95-11e6-8607-f125ff8862ab.png)

Note - I did think about merging the two tests for each case into one, but that is known to [not work correctly before](https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/pull/11912#issuecomment-266926761). 

Closes #13493

- [X] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm test`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.

#### Type of Change
<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [ ] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [X] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [X] Tested changes locally.
- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #12687

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
This is a fix for [Beta] Applied Visual Design: Adjust the Width of an Element Using the Width Property #12687
If the user had certain resolutions or browser zoom levels it could cause the computed width to be returned as a number slightly smaller or slightly larger then 245px i.e. 245.00002340523px which would cause the comparison test to fail. In order to insure the test passed the test was changed to a REGEX test using `/.fullCard\s*{[\s\S][^}]*\n*^\s*width\s*:\s*245px\s*;/gm`
The test will now succeed regardless of the users zoom level.

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [ ] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
@QuincyLarson this is an update to the coding interview / take home project pens as discussed and okayed by you a few weeks ago. Updated english page URLs as well as all corresponding translations. 

The updated projects were originally built for use in the testable projects project, and since we ultimately did not use them there (since we determined the recipe box and game of life would be nightmares to test and would restrict approach and creativity on the camper's part) we decided to update those two projects here. Also added @bonham000's Dungeon Crawler since it is just so darn FCC how could it possibly be resisted?

So updated pens include:
- [game of life](https://codepen.io/freeCodeCamp/full/BpwMZv/)
- [recipe box](https://codepen.io/freeCodeCamp/full/dNVazZ)
- [dungeon crawler](https://codepen.io/freeCodeCamp/full/apLXEJ/)

Other benefits of these pens are that the recipe box is arguably a more complete version of this app, as it contains a place for directions rather than just name and ingredients, and the game of life project provides an example that is a more common approach to the problem from a solution perspective. 

The CodePen projects featured in this section, now exactly match up with [this](https://codepen.io/collection/DdpVqq/) CodePen collection.

author: raisedadead
description:
Currently our config is hardcoded for localhost at a few places, which is okay for development. This PR aims to remove the hardcoding and allow values for `process.env.HOST` , `process.env.PORT` and `process.env.SYNC_PORT` to be configured for working in special cases such as C9 IDE.

Tested changes locally and C9 IDE.

This is advantageous in certain scenarios where contributors may want to work with a Cloud IDE, instead of a local environment.

I am up for a blog post on how I do so if this is accepted.

/cc @QuincyLarson @BerkeleyTrue

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

The test was displaying raw html code characters instead of readable text.  This was not written consistently as is with other seeds and were characters that were harmless.  When the code was checked, the codemirror console would show the string of html codes, but the checks below would show the parsed code.  Codemirror requires html codes to be searched for and fixed with a function, from what I found.  I changed them to the standard characters, since even the regex looks for those characters.

author: rafcollier
description:
<!-- freeCodeCamp Pull Request Template -->

<!-- IMPORTANT Please review https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/blob/staging/CONTRIBUTING.md for detailed contributing guidelines -->
<!-- Help with PRs can be found at https://gitter.im/FreeCodeCamp/Contributors -->
<!-- Make sure that your PR is not a duplicate -->

#### Pre-Submission Checklist
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick all the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- All points should be verified, otherwise, read the CONTRIBUTING guidelines from above-->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Your pull request targets the `staging` branch of freeCodeCamp.
- [x] Branch starts with either `fix/`, `feature/`, or `translate/` (e.g. `fix/signin-issue`)
- [x] You have only one commit (if not, [squash](http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/how-to-squash-multiple-commits-into-one-with-git/13231) them into one commit).
- [x] All new and existing tests pass the command `npm test`. Use `git commit --amend` to amend any fixes.

#### Type of Change
<!-- What type of change does your code introduce? After creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
- [x] Small bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds new functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would change existing functionality)
- [ ] Add new translation (feature adding new translations)

#### Checklist:
<!-- Go over all points below, and after creating the PR, tick the checkboxes that apply. -->
<!-- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask in the Help Contributors room linked above. We're here to help! -->
- [x] Tested changes locally.
- [ ] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #XXXX

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->

The description of the challenge "Basic HTML and HTML 5: Say Hello to HTML Elements" had several grammar issues and a lot of redundant or otherwise unnecessary text. Shorter is always better, as long as nothing meaningful is lost. 

For example, the second sentence originally finished with "walk you through web development step-by-step". But hyphens should be used here only if "step by step" appeared before the noun, as in a "step-by-step recovery". Since the phrase follows the noun, no hyphens.

Another grammar error: the comma in "do these in order, but feel free". You use a comma before "but" only when joining two independent clauses, which is not the case here. 

As for redundancies: you don't need to preface "you'll start" with "First." To start implies first. Same goes for joining a "local" study group in "your city." If it's in your city, it's local. The text also repeats the instruction to press the "Run tests" button. And the words "Note that" are never necessary. If you didn't want us to note it, you wouldn't have written it. 

Also, though I understand this is written for beginners, it sometimes reads as if it were written for children. For example: "Do you see the code in the text editor that..." It's good that the instructions are written in a simple and informal way, but there is no need to condescend. 

Oh, and the "map on the left" thing. The map is in the top menu on my browser, not on the left. Does it appear on the left for some? 

Anyway, much of this is nit-picky but just trying to help.

Note that by using the dropdown menu and selecting \"Bootstrap\", the Alpha v.4 will be added instead. And updated the `gif` with a new one that reflect the new functionality, also uploaded on `imgur` [here](http://i.imgur.com/oLYs8EA.gif) NOTE: This fix will also require to update the available translation for this challenge seed: *spanish - russian - portughese-

- [x] Closes currently open issue (replace XXXX with an issue no): Closes #13274

#### Description
<!-- Describe your changes in detail -->
Removed any mention of flex-basis from the flex-grow challenge as mentioned in the issue:

> This might be due to the flex-basis property and its rather large value for the iphone frame. Lowering the value to 2em visually shows the size differences between #box-1 and #box-2, but removing the flex-basis property altogether visually and dimensionally shows #box-2 (176 x 200) is twice as large as #box-1 (88 x 200).

which would also maintain the rule for challenge writeups: 
> Each challenge should teach exactly one concept, and that concept should be apparent from the challenge's name.
